qas.question: What is Nigeria's form of government?
What houses does the Nigerian legislature have?
How many times can a Nigerian president be elected?
Who won the 2015 Nigerian presidential election?
Who lost the 2015 Nigerian presidential election?

context: Nigeria is a <a0_0>Federal Republic<a0_0/> modelled after the United States, with executive power exercised by the president. It is influenced by the Westminster System model[citation needed] in the composition and management of the <a1_0>upper and lower<a1_0/> houses of the bicameral legislature. The president presides as both Head of State and head of the national executive; the leader is elected by popular vote to a maximum of <a2_0>two 4-year terms<a2_0/>. In the March 28, 2015 presidential election, <a3_0>General Muhammadu Buhari<a3_0/> emerged victorious to become the Federal President of Nigeria, defeating then incumbent <a4_0>Goodluck Jonathan<a4_0/>.
